welcome.title: Welcome to MIDI Chord Trainer
welcome.subtitle: Master piano chords with real-time feedback
welcome.description: Connect your MIDI keyboard and start practicing chords with instant visual and audio feedback. Track your progress and improve your skills systematically.

midiPermission.title: MIDI Access Required
midiPermission.description: This app needs access to your MIDI keyboard to provide real-time feedback. Your MIDI data stays completely private on your device.
privacy: âœ“ All MIDI processing happens locally in your browser
âœ“ No MIDI data is sent to our servers
âœ“ Your practice sessions are stored only on your device (unless you create an account)
âœ“ You can export your data anytime

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.noDevices: No MIDI devices found. Make sure your keyboard is connected and powered on.
troubleshooting.permissionDenied: MIDI access was denied. Please refresh the page and allow access when prompted.
troubleshooting.notSupported: Your browser doesn't support WebMIDI. Try Chrome, Edge, or download our desktop app.

setup.title: Setup Your Practice
setup.deviceSelection: Select your MIDI keyboard from the list below:
setup.testConnection: Play a few notes to test the connection

success.withExtraNotes: âœ“ Correct, but you played some extra notes. Try to play only the required notes.

error.wrongRoot: âœ— Wrong root note. Expected {expected}, got {actual}.
error.wrongType: âœ— Wrong chord type. You played {actual}, but we need {expected}.
error.wrongInversion: âœ— Correct chord, but wrong inversion. Try {expected} inversion.
error.incomplete: âœ— Incomplete chord. You're missing some notes.
error.notDetected: Could not detect a valid chord. Make sure to play at least 2-3 notes together.
encouragement: Review the fingering hint if needed.

tips.timing: ğŸ’¡ Tip: Try to press all notes at the same time for cleaner detection.
tips.fingering: ğŸ’¡ Tip: Use the suggested fingering (1-3-5) for better hand position.
tips.listening: ğŸ’¡ Tip: Listen to the chord sound - does it match what you expect?
tips.practice: ğŸ’¡ Tip: Practice slowly first, then gradually increase speed.
tips.inversions: ğŸ’¡ Tip: For inversions, focus on which note is in the bass (lowest).
